showScoreExcerpt:
certainly an efficient delivery system for twenty-nine of Neil Diamond’s most popular songs...he must be at least as interesting in real life as Carole King, with whom he shares much in common: They are both prolific and popular octogenarian singer-songwriters who grew up Jewish in Brooklyn. Yet I found “A Beautiful Noise:  The Neil Diamond Musical” less engaging than “Beautiful: The Carole King Musical.” Maybe it’s just a matter of taste, and not only in music. I couldn’t get past all the sequins.
